radiographic_examinations.findings: Subtle linear T2 hyperintense lesion at the T1–T3 level of the spinal cord; newly developed lesion at C7–T1; lesion extended from C2 to T4 with spotty enhancement at T1 and T3.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Lesion extended from C2 to T4 on a follow-up scan performed 5 months later.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple intense F-18 FDG accumulations in supraclavicular, paratracheal, mediastinal, bilateral hilar, internal mammary, cardio-phrenic, porta hepatis, paraaortic, and aortocaval lymph nodes; no abnormal FDG accumulation on spinal cord and brain.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up showed no abnormal F-18 FDG accumulation, indicating no evidence of active sarcoidosis.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Only faint to mild F-18 FLT accumulations observed; lower uptake compared to F-18 FDG.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up showed no abnormal F-18 FLT accumulation, indicating no evidence of active sarcoidosis.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple small centrilobular pulmonary nodules along the peribronchovascular bundle; subpleural area around the fissure.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up showed no disease activity on chest CT.
